name: If stories or videos are used then students attention and interest are quickly captured. Attention: Align content with objectives limit to 2-3 minutes.
If vivid language and varied intonation are used then students listen more attentively. Attention: Use natural intonation ensure clear instructions.
Teachers language is engaging with varied intonation
Use exclamatory sentences frequently e.g. Wow!/Look at this!
Teachers instructions are simple and clear
If gestures or eye contact are used then students attention is rekindled. Attention: Use moderate gestures maintain positive attitude.
Patting students shoulders as a reminder
If games are fun and competitive then students listen attentively to rules. Attention: Use simple rules limit to 5-10 minutes ensure participation.
Word games (e.g. train game hide-and-seek with words)
If tasks have time limits then students focus and listen to instructions. Attention: Set reasonable time match task difficulty to ability.
Specify the time for each task
If role-playing or group reading is used then students listen attentively to prepare. Attention: Use structured formats demonstrate intonation.
If videos or picture books are used then students attention is attracted. Attention: Use lesson-related materials guide focus.
If quizzes are goal-driven then students listen to questions attentively. Attention: Use tiered questions ensure fair rewards.
If movement is encouraged then students attention is rekindled. Attention: Keep activities orderly limit to 10 minutes.
Stand and read in different postures
Whole class moves to find partners (form teams)
If research tasks are assigned then students listen to requirements attentively. Attention: Use specific tasks teach tool usage.
Look up dictionary to note word meanings
Guide Students to Identify Key Points
If key words or questions are used then students comprehend lesson core. Attention: Use clear content provide feedback.
If real-life links are made then students deepen comprehension. Attention: Control sharing time ensure safe environment.
Share insights/experiences related to real life
If scenarios are created then students enhance comprehension. Attention: Align with cognitive levels provide examples.
Perspective-taking: Imagine the emotions of a character in the text
Use Images/Videos to Support Academic Activities
If images or videos are used then students comprehend via visuals. Attention: Use relevant materials guide discussion.
Imagine scenes from pictures recognize words from pictures
If storytelling is used then students listen to prepare responses. Attention: Use specific tasks encourage shy students.
Tell stories: Pair or group storytelling
If writing tasks are assigned then students listen to transform content. Attention: Use relatable topics provide frameworks.
Open-ended short writing (e.g. observing autumn scenes)
Pose Questions to Guide Word Reflection
If questions spark reflection then students listen and analyze text. Attention: Use open-ended questions allow thinking time.
Choose and share favorite words/sentences (using the structure: I choose… because…)
Retell lesson content (by cause process result)
If debates are held then students listen to opponents views. Attention: Use age-appropriate topics set clear rules.
If emotions are analyzed then students empathize via text cues. Attention: Start with simple emotions connect to experiences.
Describe similar emotions from personal life
If role-playing is used then students empathize with characters. Attention: Provide clear contexts monitor emotions.
Pretend to be the author to empathize and reflect
Empathize with the author through role-playing
If evaluations are made then students empathize via perspectives. Attention: Base on textual evidence use respectful language.
Peer evaluation: pairs whole class friends…
If collaboration is encouraged then students empathize with peers. Attention: Balance groups set collaboration rules.
Pair or group peer evaluation (exchange opinions)
Teachers Body Language for Timely Feedback
If smiles or gestures are used then students feel noticed and listen. Attention: Use sincere gestures focus on all students.
Maintain a positive attitude with smiles
Approach distracted students to remind them
Timely feedback through gestures or body movements
If drawing is assigned then students listen for inspiration. Attention: Use simple tasks provide templates limit to 10-15 minutes.
If crafts are used then students listen to steps attentively. Attention: Use safe materials explain steps clearly.
If skits are performed then students listen to prepare parts. Attention: Use lesson-related content rehearse include shy students.
Express emotions through gestures and movements
If songs are sung then students listen to lyrics attentively. Attention: Use short relevant songs control volume.
If interactive tools are used then students listen to instructions. Attention: Test equipment align with lesson goals.
Seewo Whiteboard (interactive word recognition lesson games AI dialogue projection)
If AI tools are used then students listen to feedback. Attention: Screen content for accuracy guide usage.
If video editing is assigned then students listen to guidance. Attention: Use simple tasks set time limits.
If platforms are used then students listen to content. Attention: Screen for relevance control time.
